intro: Iryanthera longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered everlet, is a striking tropical plant native to the rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy white or pale pink flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in length. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Iryanthera longiflora thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
